alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 1:26AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Cumberland, Franklin and Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Berlin, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethel, Eustis, Rumford, Rangeley and Naples.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
